Replies.Reply: CLOSE UP on the face of YURI ORLOV.
I was born Yuri Orlovitch in the city of Odessa in a country that no longer exists.
All property is theft.

Replies.Reply: Where I grew up, everyone was equal.  Some were just more equal than others.
Shortages?  What shortages?

My father was a wounded hero of World War Two, my younger brother was wounded in Afghanistan - a war without heroes.  I'd gotten out of military service due to a heart problem - it wasn't completely a lie.
And us.
We're Jewish.
We're Jewish if we say we're Jewish.
There have been few occasions in the twentieth century when it's been an advantage to be a Jew.
The rubbing from the Jewish headstone was my first forged document.  Little about my life has been kosher ever since.
We Russian Jews were supposed to be headed for Israel but I didn't see much of the country on that first trip.
Real Jews or fake Jews, eighty-five percent of us ended up in that other "promised land".
We congregated in New York's Brighton Beach because of its similarity to the Crimean Sea.  I've always thought it's appropriate we moved next door to the circus.
I had no idea my father would take his assumed identity so much to heart.  I guess he just stayed in character.
I was suffering an identity crisis of my own.
My gift for languages made me highly sought after.  The C.I.A. and U.N. were both heavily recruiting Russian immigrants.
Naturally, I went with the U.N.  They were paying more.
The fastest way to find out you can't change the world is to actually go there.

West Africa's Liberia, or "land of the free", was originally established in the 1800's as a homeland for freed American negroes.  It's been enslaved by one dictator or another ever since.  They even copied their masters' Southern architecture.
It was my first meeting with the American-
Orders.
Doesn't look like a job for two men.
It's not "bath of blood".  It's, "blood bath".
For the smile.
Fuck, no, no, no, no--fuck, no.  Money?  You want money?
Fuck, no.  Don't shoot.  Don't shoot me.

He'd come to the right place - peacekeepers are armed to the teeth.  And nothing but premium product.  The U.N. mostly buys from Switzerland - where else?
Whatever you want.
Would nothing be better?

Replies.Reply: "misplaced" weapons on that one trip alone.
My tour as a peacekeeper was the perfect preparation for war.

Arms dealers - because everybody else is too busy killing each other.
That's the point.  I've seen how the world's coming apart.
You can't stop it.
It's a basic human need - we eat, sleep, sleep with each other and what else?  Fight.
I know which end I'd rather be on.
Every day there are people shooting at each other.  I think to myself, what guns are they using?  Why not mine?
Vitaly, I've tasted your borscht, you're no fucking chef.  I can eat here for free and I still don't eat here.  You're doing nothing with your life.
That's why I need you.
Brothers in arms.
Yes.
It wasn't God I was trying to get close to.
Dad's contacts at synagogue landed me my first Israeli-made Uzis and an introduction to the biggest of the big guns.
It was the eighties and the Cold War was far from thawed.  Most of the deals were government-to-government.  There were some go-
- both sides, sold missiles to Argentina in the Falklands.  Hets a fucking legend.  I've got to talk to him.
Simeon!  Simeon!
A mutual friend, Eli Kurtzman from Brighton Beach Import-Export said to contact you.  I have a business proposal.  Perhaps we can discuss it - over a drink.
Yuri watches Simeon go, surrounded by flunkies.
Vitaly and I found our niche in under-the-
The job wasn't so different trom the U.N.  I was just as neutral working for the ununited nations.  An equal opportunity "merchant of death", I supplied every army but the Salvation Army.
We got our start in Lebanon after the suicide bombing.
When the United States leaves a war zone, they generally don't take their munitions.
I sell by the kilo.
They're second-hand weapons but they're still okay.
For all my language skills, I soon discovered that what talks best is money.
This is bullshit money, Vit - small fucking potatoes.
No.  More illegal.
It's not our fight.
I sold Israeli-made Uzis to Muslims.
I sold to both Pakistan and India in their fight tor the most inhospitable land on earth.
How's it going?
Make sure you thaw out the guns before you fight.
We had our set-backs.  It's not called gunrunning for nothing.
Cannibal, what's going on?
What?!  What do you mean it's over?
Friends?!  You can't be fucking friends.

Replies.Reply: Cannibal, don't you fucking walk away from me!
Fuck you, Cannibal!!
At least when they say they're going to have a war, they keep their word.
I even shipped cargo to Afghanistan when they were still fighting fellow Russians.
Personal use.
I'm kind of trigger happy.
And everywhere I went, Ava Cordova kept following me around.  We were as international as each other.
Operations like mine provided the only way for certain regimes to conduct a respectable war.

The freighter I was standing on carried 113 tons of weapons and ammunition for delivery to one of the poorest nations in Latin America in direct contravention of half a dozen international arms embargoes.
To keep authorities in the dark, I often spoke in code.  Rocket launchers were "mothers", the rockets "children".  Assault rifles were "apples".  The AK-47 was "the Angel King".
Forget it.
No, no-one's going anywhere.
Slow--dead slow.  Buy me time.
Get that fucking rag down!

They say every man has his price - but not every man gets it.  Interpol Agent, Jack Valentine, couldn't be bought, at least not with money.  For Jack, glory was the prize.

Replies.Reply: The first and most important rule of gunrunning is never get shot with your own merchandise.

The second rule is always ensure you have a foolproof way to get paid.  Credit card, check, cash.  Preferably in advance, ideally to an off-shore account.  It's why I choose my customers so carefully.  Say what you like about warlords and dictators, they tend to have a highly developed sense of order.
I understand.
What is this?
I can't hand this to my fucking bank teller at Chase Manhattan.
I sell guns.  I don't sell drugs.
I've got standards.
Vit.
I found Vitaly twelve days, two thousand miles and 150 grams later in a Bolivian boarding house.
Vitaly!  Open this fucking door!
What the fuck is that?
--You'll be fucking dead before you reach Kiev.
Get out of the car.
I promised our parents.
Vitaly, you're going to have a good time.

I never understood what separated the recreational drug user from the habitual, the functional addict from the dysfunctional.  But for the grace of God, it could have been me snorting lines as long as the Belt Parkway.
After Colombia I became a one-man-operation.
By then I'd mastered my craft.  Selling arms is not so different to selling vacuum cleaners.  You advertise, pound the pavement, take orders.
Of course, a good arms dealer also has to be a political scientist.  I go by a seven-step approach.
One: identity a government and an opposition where the opposition is ignored.
Two: Wait for a radical group to break away from the opposition.
Three: Immediately approach the radical group and offer them arms.
Four: Whether they buy or not, inform the government that the radical group approached you and offer the government arms.

Five: Whether they buy or not, re-approach the radical group and offer them more arms but now at a higher price.  Increasing tension is a means of generating demand and the ideal situation is to sell to both sides.
Six: If they start shooting at each other, the escalation is underway.
They are consuming small arms and ammunition and the cash register is well and truly ringing.
Seven: Don't forget that the success of a radical group in one country can inspire a radical group in a neighboring country.
The beer.
It cost me twenty for the fake booking, another twelve to buy out the hotel.  You can't force someone to tall in love with you but you can sure make ita damn sight easier.
Yuri Orlov.  What brings you to St. Barts?
Those things can come out of nowhere.
You can hitch a ride with me if you like.
In the meantime, why don't I take your picture?
In my experience some of the most successful relationships are founded on lies and deceit.  Since that's where they usually end up anyway, it's a logical place to start.
I nearly went broke trying to convince her I was anything but.  I knew Ava was not the kind of woman to be seduced by a ride in a private jet unless you owned the jet.
That is my name.
Of course I was lying.  The plane was a rental, like the car and even the suit I was standing in.  At the last minute, I bribed the crew for the paint-job.
Luckily, by the time we landed, Ava wasn't looking anywhere but in my eyes.
I had no idea.

Replies.Reply: I'm sorry I didn't recognize you.  You must think me very rude.

Without it, I'd never have met you.
I don't believe in fate.
We married in a synagogue to make my father happy.  In the eyes of my Catholic mother, it was worse than living in sin.
It's traditional.

I'm sorry.  I should have said something.

Replies.Reply: Sure, Dad.  A forty-thousand dollar crystal chandelier.
Mom, we don't need anything.

I was still living way beyond my means, mortgaged to the hilt, using one credit card to payoff another.  Anything to keep Ava in the style to which she had, thanks largely to me, become accustomed.  Then suddenly all my Christmases came at once.
Ava scoops up the baby.  With Anatoly and Irina, they go to investigate.
It's over!  It's over!
The Cold War, the Soviet Union, the Evil Empire.  Mikhail's saying "no mas".  He's throwing in the towel.  It's over.
I think I'll go back for a visit.
Do you stay in touch with Uncle Dmitri?
How is he?
He's still a General in the army?
He may be luckier than you think.
You're only remembered when you're dead.
I'll bring you back some caviar.
I'm going back to Ukraine.
I miss you too.
There's no problem leading a double life.
Back then I carried a French, British, Israeli and Ukrainian passport and a student visa for the U.S., but that's another story.
I also packed five different briefcases depending on the region of the world I was visiting.
The end of the Cold War was the beginning of the hottest time in arms dealing.  The Wall had fallen.  The arms bazaar was open.
It's good to be home.
--Report to who?  Moscow?  As of last week Moscow is in a foreign country.
There is no new boss yet.  They're too busy squabbling over who gets the presidential holiday home at the Black Sea.
It's beautiful.  The ones who know don't care any more.  The ones who care don't know.
Show me your inventory.

There's no place in gunrunning for politics anymore, Simeon.  I sell to leftists, rightists.  I'd sell to pacifists but they're not the most regular of customers.
Of course, you're not a true internationalist until you've supplied weapons to kill your own countrymen.
I think you are the amateur now.  I think you suffer from a philosophical disadvantage - you have a philosophy.  I think you should go with your instincts - your first instinct.
I am the same man who was not good enough for you before.  I am not good enough for you now.

arms have been stolen and re-sold.  One of the greatest heists of the 20th Century.
The primary market was Africa.  Eleven major conflicts involving 32 countries in the past decade - a gunrunner's wet dream.

My best customer was self-declared president of Liberia, Andre Baptiste.  Even though we'd met before, I was in no hurry to meet him again.  He'd gotten a reputation for routinely hacking off the limbs of those who opposed him.  His seven-year civil war has been described as "a relentless campaign of sadistic, wanton violence unimaginable to those unfamiliar with the details of man's capacity to visit the abyss."  That kind of sums up Andy for me.
Thank him but I have other business.  A busy schedule.
What do you know?  My schedule just freed up.
But if I thought I was scared of Andre Senior, I knew I was scared of Andre Junior.

Monrovia itself was like being on another planet.  Planet Monrovia.  From the temperature it was obviously a planet close to the sun.  I rarely saw another white man even at my hotel that was soon dubbed the "Little Kremlin".  And I never left town alone.  Outside town, was the edge of hell.
Part One, Two or Three?
The M60.  You want the attachable grenade launcher?
In the most AIDS infested region of the globe, where one in four is infected, Andre's idea of a joke was to put a young Iman and a young Naomi naked in my bed and no condom within a hundred miles.
How do you know?
What if I have AIDS?  Don't you worry?

Replies.Reply: By leaving.
--that's the Beretta, comes with a 36 cartridge, easy-operating clip--
Jesus, why did you do that?
Now you're going to have to buy it.
It's a used gun.  I can't sell a used gun.
I had heard of the "Boy Brigades", "Small Boy Units", "Kalashnikov Kids".  The theory was that a bullet coming from a fourteen year old is just as effective as one trom a forty year old.

You can't just look at the unit price.  You forget the ancillary costs.  End user certificates need to be forged and notarized, shell companies set up, insurance purchased, pilots and crews hired.  Not to mention the bribes.  You can't get a nut and bolt out of the Eastern bloc without a bribe.  There's one bribe for the nut.
I'll take the stones.  It's hard to get a tree trunk in my hand luggage.

I figured I was a patron of the arts and of everything else Ava had tried and failed at after modelling.  Acting, her own cosmetics line.  I didn't sabotage her careers but I can't deny it was convenient for me in maintaining a low profile.  She was a beautiful bird in a gilded cage.
How are you, brother?
Someone has to do it.
We don't talk about it.
How many car salesmen talk about their work, how many executives at cigarette companies?
The trip went better than expected.
I know just the outfit.

I didn't know how much she knew and how much she ignored.  I was a good provider and as far as she was concerned - loyal.  Despite the other women, I always made love to Ava as if she was the only one.

Can I go?  You've got nothing on me--

After surviving the last few days I'd started to feel like I was invincible.  But there was a weapon that could hurt me.

--It's not about the money.

I'll stop.

I'll stop.

--Impossible.  Two and a quarter?  I can't make a profit at two and a quarter.  Why don't you take my oil and I'll fucking pay you?

She looked me directly in the eye the way I've looked in the eyes of a thousand customs officials, government bureaucrats and footsoldiers from every law enforcement agency in the world - and she lied without flinching.
She'd learned from the best.
I can always sense when I'm being tailed.  I know what to look for.  But then I'd never been tailed by the woman I love.
I can put myself in Ava's place.  She might have understood if the combination was the last four digits of my social, my birthdate, even her birthdate but not Nicolai's.

Vitaly broke the cardinal rule of gunrunning.  Never pick up a gun and join the customers.
Coffins are hard to come by in Sierra Leone.
I don't know which is worse, Jewish guilt or Catholic guilt.  My parents were like God's tag-team.

For twenty Monrovian dollars a doctor removed the lead from Vitaly's body and wrote a bogus death certificate.  I should have paid more.

This.  Tell me that I am everything you despise, that I am the personification of evil, that I'm responsible for the breakdown of the social fabric of society and world order, that I am a one man genocide.  Say everything you want to say to me now -

My family has disowned me.  My wife and son have left me.  My brother is dead.  Trust me, I fully appreciate the seriousness of my situation.  But I promise you I won't spend a single second in a courtroom.
I like you, Jack.  Well, maybe not.  But I understand you.  You feel your loyalty to your badge has finally been rewarded.  But you haven't counted on the people who gave you that badge.
Let me tell you what's going to happen so you can prepare yourself.
Soon there's going to be a knock on that door and you're going to be called outside.
In the hall there will be a man who outranks you.
First, he will compliment you on the fine job you've done, how you're making the world a safer place and then he is going to tell you that I am to be released.
You are going to protest, you will probably threaten to resign.
But in the end I will be released.
The reason I'll be released is the same reason you think I will be convicted.  I do rub shoulders with the most vile, sadistic men calling themselves leaders today.
But some of those men are the enemies of your enemies.

And while the biggest arms dealer in the world is your boss, the President of the United States - who ships more merchandise in a day than I do in a year - sometimes it's embarrassing to have his fingerprints on the guns.  Sometimes he needs a freelancer like me to supply opposition forces he can't be seen supplying.  You call me evil, but, unfortunately for you, I am a necessary evil.
What if I'm not?  What if I sleep fine at night?  What if I sleep better than you? I think that's what truly scares you.
Most people are happy just to get out of jail.  I expect to be paid to leave.
I'm not a fool.  I know that just because they need me one day doesn't mean they won't make me a scapegoat the next.  But I was back doing what I do best.
Sun umbrellas.

Replies.Reply: Something for Yuri.

Replies.Reply: Aren't you going to help me hold my cock?

You know you are fighting a losing battle, my young friend.  War is nature.  If you take away the guns, we will kill each other with knives.  Take away the knives, we will kill each other with sticks.  Take away the sticks, we will kill each other with your peace treaties.
You cannot stop this bath of blood.
Thank you.  But I like it my way.
What did you say?
A used gun.  That's a good one.
There's no discipline with the young boys.
Let me show you something.
I can't pay your asking price, Yuri.  We are not a rich people and the market is already flooded with your Kalashnikovs.  In some places you can buy one for the price of a chicken.
Very professional, Lieutenant.
They say I am the lord of war.  But perhaps it is you.
I like it my way.
Baby blue.  My favorite color!

Replies.Reply: Don't apologize.  I put on clothes for a living.

Business is good.

What's over?
That's nice.

Yes, I'll accept the charges.
Hey, baby.
They're going in another direction.  The direction of someone who can act.
And you're biased.
Where are you?  Is everything okay?
Come home.  We miss you.
Asleep in our bed.  It's lonely without you.
Yuri, what's that?

I love you.

Replies.Reply: I'm sorry.  Poor darling.  He tried to stay up.

Yuri!

But what am I going to wear them with?
Hush, Nicki.
I don't believe you.
Can you prove any of it?  Where is your evidence?
Get out.
He's with your parents.
I can't wear the clothes.  I can't wear the jewelry.  I can't drive the car.  I can't live in this house.  Everything1s got blood on it.
Of course I'm melodramatic.  I'm a failed actress, remember?  We need to talk about it.
Now we do.
--I've talked to your parents.  Why do you think they don't want your money?  They know where it comes from.  We all know.
--Yuri, I see the news.  Sierra Leone--
--What do you think is pointing at the victims when they use those machetes?  I see the pictures.  Yuri, the guns are bigger than the boys.
I don't care if it's legal, it's wrong.
Please stop.
Let them.  We have enough.  You're not that little boy in Odessa anymore, lining up for a loaf of bread--
What is it?

I feel like all I've done my whole life is be pretty.  All I've done is be born.  I'm not just a failed actress.  I'm also a failed writer, failed artist, failed businesswoman.  I'm not much good as a mother.  Come to think of it, I'm not even that pretty any more.  I've failed at everything, Yuri.
But I won't fail as a human being.  I'm leaving.
You will?  You promise?
Yuri, the President of Liberia is in the lobby.
Was that about the oil or the timber?
Sorry, Nicki has swim practice.
Personally, I'm glad you're going.  You've been here so long you're starting to get on my nerves.
That would be fun.
Yes, I trust you.
That's him.
It's a game.
Yes.
Not that.  Not that, Yuri.
Don't touch what you can't afford.
What's this?
Glock .45.
Jackson.

Replies.Reply: President Jackson.

Demand and supply.
There is more I am thinking where this comes from.

Replies.Reply: Kelly green.

Yuri!  Yuri Orlov!

An aid program?
Sure.  Climb in.

--I can get you the shoulder-fired SA-7 surface-to-air missiles.  The older Chinese model.  Not so effective against modern military aircraft but deadly if used against a commercial airliner.  I'm giving them away at eight-fifty.
May I help you?
You're in the wrong place my young friend.
Do you know who the fuck I am?
I demand to see your commanding officer.
Just give me back my papers.
I am here, aren't I?
I can't deny, it takes some getting used to.
I understand you have Ukraine in your pocket but there are the other satellite states.
The problem with gunrunners going to war is there's no shortage of ammunition.

Replies.Reply: showing images of the aftermath of the suicide bombing at the U.S.
We're making terrific progress - most casualties from avalanches and frostbite.
Cease fire, man.  Cease fire.  It's over.
Truce.  We're friends, man.
That was last week, man.
Peace, man!
I hope you're not thinking of selling these, Mr. Orlov.
There's a hundred thousand bullets here.
Do we run?
Not exactly "The Love Boat".
Papers.
Mr. Orlov, always in the wrong place at the right time.  We've met before.  Off the coast of Colombia.
What was the name of that freighter - I can't remember.  Was it the Kono or the Kristol?
The end-user certificate for this aircraft states Burkina Faso.  Nice.  Did you type it yourself?
You're a humanitarian?
This is a killing machine.
Also going to Burkina Faso?
What do you take me for?  A complete fucking fool?
You expect me to believe this is a coincidence?
Yuri Orlov.  You and I are going to be seeing a lot of each other.
Watch out for the time you don't see me.
Where in God's name is he going?  Is he lost?
--Charlie, Echo, India.  Comply immediately.
Rock your wings if you intend to comply.
He can't get far.  I want a truck waiting on the tarmac.
Hey, you!
Forget it.
No, Mbizi.  No, no, no.
I can't do that.
We will.
No.
Find the pilots.
I've spent my whole career on the right side of the line.  You're the first man I've encountered who makes me seriously consider crossing it.
What are you doing in Sierra Leone?
Shooting wildebeests with submachine guns?
You're trafficking arms.
Trade or traffic, you make a fortune by keeping the poorest people on the planet killing each other.

There are more prestigious assignments, you know.  Keeping track of the nuclear arsenals.  You would think it more critical to world security.  It's not.  Nine out of ten war victims today are killed by assault rifles and other small arms - like yours.
I am legally permitted to hold you for twenty-four hours without charging you.
You may ask, why do I bother to do that?  I can assure you, it is not because I enjoy your company.  And you may be surprised to learn that it is not for any vindictive motive.  No.
See you in twenty-three hours and fifty five minutes.
You'll be pleased to know your colleagues were no more co-operative than you.
The locals got to them before we could.
Handsome family.
I was hoping you could help us with that.
One of yours?
Curiously, the death certificate says he died of heart failure.
We performed the autopsy and released your brother's body to your family.  You tried to do something decent, Yuri.  You went against your nature.  And now it's cost you.
Your brother's funeral is looking a lot like your funeral.
You're right, as usual.
Have you seen today's paper?
Replies.Didascalie: (cont'd) (putting a copy of the New York Times in front of Yuri)

Replies.Reply: Fake end-user certificates, cut-out companies, all meticulously catalogued.
She has agreed to testify against you.
What?

Are you not paying attention or are you delusional?  You've broken every arms embargo written.  There's enough in those briefcases to buy you consecutive life sentences.  You'll spend ten years going from a cell to a courtroom before you even start doing your time.
You don't seem to fully appreciate the seriousness of your situation!
You are delusional.
I would tell you to go to hell.  But I think you're already there.
Sir, sighting of the Kristol due north.
--There's really no one else you'd consider?
However, since you are willing to double her rate and pay cash in advance.  She loves working with Herb and you say the campaign will only be seen in Asia?
Yuri Orlov, we're with the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms.
You have the right to remain silent.  Use it.
You're late.
Fuck you!

Angel.

Nephew, come here and hug the luckiest man alive.
What?  Did you think I'd be glowing?  Don't worry.  You can't catch it.

Someone will work this out, Yuri.  What happens then?

We shoot it out?
So we run.

Who the fuck cares who the fuck you are?
You don't demand shit.

--I'll tell you what I'll do.  Buy six, you get one free.
No problem.
He's the tech support.
Thirteen.  Almost fourteen.
He can take it apart in his sleep.

Hello, Mr. Yuri.
Don't worry, we don't have anything.
You worry too much.

We'd be happy to make you happy.
Do we look like it?

Dismissed!
--Even taking into consideration the pay-off to the parents, a week with a girl in Burkina Faso is cheaper than a night with a girl in Jersey.
--and a lot of them speak better English.
I'm putting us down.
We're in a flying fucking bomb!  They're firing bullets at our bullets!  Forget about going away!  They shoot again, we're going away for good!  I'm putting us down.
This is Charlie Echo India.  Descending on heading zero two nine.
A pothole could set us off.
As far from the evidence as I can.
Plus, they're cleaner--
Personally, I prefer a language barrier--
Motherfucker!
I can't land there.
You run from us.
Can you run with no legs?
Let me disappear him, Mr.  Valentine.  He is a devil.  Let me disappear him.
Look where we are.  Who will know?
Turn your back, Mr. Valentine.  I will go to hell to stop him.
He bought you "brown-brown", Mr. Yuri.
"Brown-brown".
A mixture - cocaine and gunpowder.
It's magic.  They give it to the small boys before battle - they do anything.
You have to try it at least once, Mr. Yuri.
Because it's your gunpowder.
It's not what I would call a fuck.

Replies.Reply: You have no heart.
Have you seen the news?  They accuse me of rigging elections, but after this in your Florida with your Supreme Court of kangaroos--
--now the U.S. must shut up forever.
Why is nothing happening?
We're here for the peace talks at the U.N.
Is that what you still are?  You're a hard man to get hold of all of a sudden.
--But now you mention it, we are doing a little shopping while we're here - that is if you open for business.
Of course they blame me.  They always blame me.  They are on a--
"Witch-hunt".  But I have been granted diplomatic immunity due to the escalation in hostilities.
That is why I need you.  They are making life difficult to re-supply.  It will require a man of your unusual ingenuity.
I understand.
But you should know that our present difficulties compel us to be unusually generous.
Farewell, Lord of War.
And now, one of the sponsors of tonight's evening, former Miss World, Ava Cordova.
Liberia.  Is that on Long Island?
Bye, Papa.

Like hide and seek?
